item.title: Two light in St George's CHurchyard not working since early Dec 2025, 30th January
item.description:
Two lamps in St George's Churchyard remain in darkness over a month since first reported. This makes the rear of the church dangerous for those walking through the churchyard or entering and leaving the church. Please can you advise why there is a delay in repairing these lights. With grateful thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path street lightling in the park, 30th January
item.description:
Good afternoon I live in Shortlands overlooking the park in front of Shortlands station (Station Road entrance). I walk from Bromley shopping centre to home – most day’s but not now that the nights are darker. I walk pass the AFC Shortlands football centre and it is extremely dark. Is there any way we could get some lighting on that side of the park. It’s a little dangerous I think for a young woman to be walking on her own along that path from Bromley shopping centre to Shortlands train station. My personal details are below if you would like to contact me. Looking forward to hearing from you. Regards Eslin Dennie Flat 6 11 Station Road Shortlands BR2 0EY LONDON 07977603865
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Martin's Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parked in same place over a year, 30th January
item.description:
The car hasn’t moved in a year..: has punctured tyres and needs to be gone as we have no parking spots on are road .. the grey car next to it is the same

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Granite Street, Plumstead

item.title: Overgrown May tree blocking pavement, 30th January
item.description:

item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Large amount of builders rubbish on Jowett St, 30th January
item.description:
Flat 6 at 2 Jowett St has had length construction works going for a number of weeks. The tradesmen working on the flat have dumped the waste from the renovation works next to the building. Additionally, individuals from Carisbrooke Gardens estate have dumped household waste. The waste has accumulated to the point where it’s attracting vermin and blocking entry to the children’s park next to it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jowett Street, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pile of animal faeces, 30th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pot hole and stones around the hole, 30th January
item.description:
Various holes along the street but outside 211 there is a large hole that is getting bigger. Chips have come off and have narrowly missed my child. The report's reference number is 8798133. Please quote this if you need to contact the council about this report. Already reported and marked as fixed however it hasn't?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 218, Erith Road, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
